detailsOfAchievement: Launched a project that eventually led to the birth of the rural peoples Society Development Concept (RPSDC) in 2019. RPSD is a document (one of the first of its kind in the world) that defines the mutually complementary roles of public authorities and civic organizations, and lays out principles and mechanisms for cooperation in shaping and implementing public policies and building civil society in Estonia. After that we have been one of the leaders of the process of RPSDC implementation.

detailsOfAchievement: Our Major Activities are - Education for Downtrodden and Destitute Children of SC and Tribal Communities - Formation of Farmer Producer Organizations ( FPOs) and Organic Agri-promotion - Health Education and Check ups to Children, Youths, Adolescents, Women - School Hygiene Education - Anti-drug Campaigning - Conservation of Critically Endangered Species in Southern Western Ghats and Eastern Ghats - Palliative and Elders Care Program -Gender Sensitization - Advocacy for Land Rights

sourceOfFunds.purpose: With the support of Tamil Nadu State Social Welfare Board and a few individuals from Austria run five Balwadis (Day Care Centre for Kids) in five tribal villages of Palani Hill ranges. Later on, four centres were adopted by the Integrated Child Development Service (ICDS) under Tamil Nadu State Government in the year 2007  2008. Through the programme enabled the children to acquire basic education with nutritious support and health care.

ACT India Foundation conducted group discussions with the parents of the tribal children to strengthen their education. Some parents showed their inclination in strengthening the education of their children, but they exposed that the children commuting between home and school are having transport difficulties and not safe for them to travel long distance in the forest. Considering this fact, the Vanavil Tribal Children Home was established in a rental building at Pannaikadu in 1998.

Priority Species and Sites Protection In collaboration with ATREE  CEPF SG Programme, ACT India Foundation has implemented activities that are necessary to protect priority species and sites in the Palani Hills, Western Ghats, since 2009. ACT India Foundation has worked among 20 tribal hamlets on protecting the threatened species (Grizzled Giant Squirrel) and establishing / maintaining canopy cover area and linkages to corridors

There are 28 children from 10 tribal hamlets, who finds difficult in accessing the formal education due to their geographical location and family background, benefiting from it. These children stay in the home and study in the nearby schools. They are given life education and skill training to face the mainstream society, access the formal education and preserve their traditional knowledge and wisdom.

MFP / NTFP Collectors: As part of livelihood activity, the tribal collect Lieckens, a kind of parasite plant growing on the trees, which is used as a spice in food and preparation of vegetable dyes. When they collect it from the trees, the tribal remove the upper skin of the trees, which cause the damage to the life of the trees. Like this, there are so many damages made by the tribal without awareness of what they do, while collecting their livelihood.

It is a place for encouraging the tribal children, who attend the formal education, in order to cope with the formal education in an effective way. There were five centres in five villages. Each centre had an Animator to look after the children, who attend the centre in the evening from 5.00 to 7.00.They start with playing their traditional and creative games for one hour. Then they will take coaching of their formal education and do the home works.

The children home will improve educational opportunities for the tribal children who are deprived of their right to education. It is mainly Because of the absence of a school in approachable distance. The tribal are treated as untouchables by the dominant communities .They was not permitted to attend schools and sit in par with the children of other communities. As a result the tribal showed no interest in educating their wards.

HEKSs support: HEKS supports to work on RFRA  2006 in 10 tribal hamlets, where the children of foster care programme come from. Community based programmes, including educational meetings, and other activities are carried out to strengthen these communities in achieving their rights provided in this Act.All the previous Acts have ignored and stood against the existence of tribal in the forest. This is the first Act of its kind, which has recognised and supported the tribal.

.ACTIF Trust has conducted this programme in six villages, namely, Moolaiyaru, Vadaharapparai, Valagiri, Keelkumburaiyur, Kaduhuthadi and Thamaraikkulam through house visits, village level group meetings and treating the minor ailments. A trained MPHW conducted this programme for the pregnant women, lactating mothers and women with minor ailments. The health worker followed up the immunisation programme in these villages. About 275 families benefitted out of this programme.

In this project major objective is to promote or educate the 22000 tribal peoples economical status in tamilnadu through getting their lands under forest rights act 2006. we are educate the tribal people to access to land and cultivate the organic products. After they cultivate this organic vegetable we educate the marketing systems of their product.Not only the marketing support but also the value add skill development training for their products end of the project 22000 tribal will develop

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Active Heart Foundation desired to establish an irrevocable Public Charitable Trust for the purpose of carrying the charitable objects of general public utility not involving the carrying on of any activity for profit.It intends to extend services to people of all religion, caste,community,creed,region and race.Our vision is to establish a society which will be well aware of life threatening cardiac problems and train them to get rid of the menace.

detailsOfAchievement: Through various vocational training programme around 1200 got benefited among them about 800 were provided with placement services and around 300 were motivated to develop them as entrepreneurs according to their capacities and interest.  Every year we support the poor children by providing them educational support by giving them bags, books and educational materials.  We have provided skill training programme tailoring, two wheeler mechanic, electrician course for the boys and girls in the Juvenile justice home in which around 400 children got benefited. We have also provided them life skill enhancement training with the activity based module.  Many adolescents and youth have changed their life through group awareness programmes and other initiatives.  The poor economic children were able to continue their education through the support provided for their education. Every year around 300 HIV infected families are given care and support service by providing them nutrition supplements which motivated them to get interest in their life.  Provided relief services to the victims affected by Jammu and Kashmir Floods in which 120 families got benefited.  Farmers were given training on gardening courses, they were taken to exposure visit in the banana farming area in Trichy to support them in yeilding profitable cultivation.  During Thane cyclone we have supported more than 1000 people affected by giving them relief materials in cuddalore district.  In the katmand earthquake in nepal we have supported 300 families by giving the relief materials like clothing, tarpaulin, foods, water bottles etc.  During the drastic flood taken place in Tamilnadu on December 2015 we have involved in rescuing the people struck in the flood by the boats. We have also supported the victims in the districts of Chennai, Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram and Cuddalore districts by providing them relief services like food, water bottles, bed sheets, household materials etc.
